intro: Astragalus faghirensis, commonly known as the Faghirensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers clustered in racemes, which are typically pollinated by insects. Astragalus faghirensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
